chicken

you can cook this dish
keeping the chicken wing at the hole but
I preferred cutting them up so it's
easier to deep-fry cut through the
cattle edge at the joint to remove the
two parts of the chicken wing place the
wings in between two layers of kitchen

season lightly with salt and pepper just
a little bit so that the seasonings can
go deeper into the meat we're gonna dip
it into the cheese sauce later so you
don't want to over season them slowly
patting the chicken wings to help them
absorb the seasonings
turn the chicken wings over and do the
same thing with the other side in a

of garlic and three chilies of course
you can use more on a Chili's depending
on how spicy you can take you can also
means Carla can she leave with a knife
but I prefer mortar and pestle because

and 3 tbsp of water
also adding a tablespoon of lime juice
or lemon juice stir well so that the
sugar is completely dissolved we are
making a very delicious dipping sauce
here you can use this dipping sauce not
only for this dish but also for other
Vietnamese dishes add the crushed garlic
and chilli on top s last so that it
float to the surface and make the
dipping sauce look more tempting next in
the ziplock bag or a big plastic bag add
in 2 tbsp of tapioca starch or corn

wings give it a good shake so that the
chicken wings are well coated in the
pasta
now in a large nonstick pan adding
vegetable oil just enough to cover the
bottom of the pan
slightly shake off the excess starch add
in the chicken wings why the oil still
coal
then turn on the heat to medium-high
when the temperature increases it will
cook the chicken inside out making it

occasionally use a ladle to visit the
eye over the chickens so that that can

after around ten minute tip flying you

by loading brow then turn them over and
get five on the other side for another
ten minutes after this flying for 20
minutes the chicken wings should have
been cooked for they have turned golden
brown and look very crispy and delicious
now you have two options either remove
the chicken wings and dip it into the
sauce while still hot or you remove all
the wings and rein up the excess oil
transfer the wings back to the pan pour
the sauce over and simmer under low heat
for about five to ten more minutes I
prefer the first option because I don't
want to cook the fish sauce for too long
it can make the house smell really bad
it's important that you dip the chicken
wings into the sauce when they are too
hot they can absorb the sauce really
quick and become very tasty and juicy
